title: effect to Council Regulation (EC) No. 2017/821 of 17 May 20171 hereby make
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Certain
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Certain 
Minerals from Conflict Zones - Tin, Tantalum, Tungsten, their Ores and Gold) 
(Supply Chain Obligations) Regulations 2021. 

(2) In these Regulations- 

“EU Regulation” means Regulation (EU) 2017/821 of the European Parliament 
and of the Council of 17 May 20171; 

“Minister” means 
Communications. 

the Minister 

for 

the Environment, Climate and

title: effect to Council Regulation (EC) No. 2017/821 of 17 May 20171 hereby make
heading: 2. The Competent Authority, being the Minister, designated by the State
text_raw:
2. The Competent Authority, being the Minister, designated by the State 
pursuant to the first paragraph of Article 10 of the EU Regulation, has the 
functions provided for in the third paragraph of that Article within the State.
text_norm: 2 competent authority minister designated state pursuant first paragraph article 10 eu regulation function provided third paragraph article within state

title: effect to Council Regulation (EC) No. 2017/821 of 17 May 20171 hereby make
heading: 3. A person who breaches Article 3(1), 4, 5, 6 or 7 of the EU Regulation
text_raw:
3. A person who breaches Article 3(1), 4, 5, 6 or 7 of the EU Regulation 
commits an offence and, subject to Regulation 4, is liable on summary 
conviction, to a class A fine or imprisonment for a term not exceeding 6 
months or both.
text_norm: 3 person breach article 3(1) 4 5 6 7 eu regulation commits offence subject regulation 4 liable summary conviction class fine imprisonment term exceeding 6 month both

title: effect to Council Regulation (EC) No. 2017/821 of 17 May 20171 hereby make
heading: 4. (1) Where a breach of Article 3(1), 4, 5, 6 or 7 of the EU Regulation has
text_raw:
4. (1) Where a breach of Article 3(1), 4, 5, 6 or 7 of the EU Regulation has 
occurred, the Minister shall issue a notice of remedial action to the Union 
importer concerned, referring to the particular breach that has occurred and 
specifying particulars of remedial action that the importer shall take. 

(2) A notice issued under paragraph (1) shall specify a time period within 

which the remedial action shall be taken. 

(3) A person to whom a notice has been issued under paragraph (1) shall, 
within the period specified in the notice, take the remedial action required and 

1 OJ L 130, 19.05/2017, p. 1. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 26th January, 2021. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [16] 3 

provide to the Minister sufficient information in order for the Minister to 
establish whether such remedial action as has been specified in the notice has 
been taken. 

(4) A person who fails to comply with a notice issued under paragraph (1) 
within the period specified or who fails to supply sufficient information as 
required under paragraph (3), is liable to be prosecuted for breach of the Article 
or provision of the Article of the EU Regulation which is referred to in the 
notice and to which the failure to comply or the failure to supply sufficient 
information relates.

title: effect to Council Regulation (EC) No. 2017/821 of 17 May 20171 hereby make
heading: 5. Where an offence under these Regulations is committed by a body
text_raw:
5. Where an offence under these Regulations is committed by a body 
corporate and is proved to have been so committed with the consent or 
connivance, or was attributable to any wilful neglect, of a person who was a 
director, manager, secretary or other officer of the body corporate, or a person 
purporting to act in that capacity, that person, as well as the body corporate, 
commits an offence and may be proceeded against as if he or she commits the 
first-mentioned offence. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

21 January 2021. 

EAMON RYAN 

Minister for the Environment, Climate and 
Communications.
